retellStory.prompt: My grandmother told me a story about her first job. She worked in a small bakery making cakes and pastries. She had to wake up very early every morning. She said it was hard work but she enjoyed it.

Last night, I watched a fascinating documentary about animals in the jungle. I saw colourful birds, big elephants, and even a tiger. The film showed how these animals live and find their food. I learned a lot about nature.

One sunny morning, a little bird flew into our kitchen through an open window. It was a bit scared and started flying around very fast. My dad gently opened the back door, and the bird quickly flew outside to freedom. We were happy it was safe.

Last winter, there was a lot of snow in our village. The children were very excited and built a huge snowman in their front garden. They put a carrot for its nose and stones for its eyes. Everyone who passed by smiled at the friendly snowman.

Yesterday, a heavy rainstorm started suddenly in the afternoon. The streets quickly filled with water, and everyone ran for cover. Luckily, the rain stopped after about an hour. The sun then came out, and a beautiful rainbow appeared.
Tom's dog, Max, loves to play fetch in the park. Tom throws the ball, and Max runs very fast to catch it. Sometimes, Max brings a stick instead of the ball. They always have a lot of fun together.
Emily needed a new book to read. She went to the library and looked at many different stories. She chose a mystery book and took it home to read.
Mark loves to cook. Last night, he made a delicious pasta dish for dinner. His family said it was the best pasta they had ever tasted.
After work, Maria always goes for a run. She runs for thirty minutes in the park. It helps her to relax and feel healthy.

My friend invited me to her house for dinner last Saturday. She cooked a delicious curry with rice and a fresh salad. We talked for hours and listened to music. It was a very enjoyable evening with good food and good company.
It was raining heavily, so Jane decided to stay home. She made a cup of hot chocolate and read a book by the window, listening to the rain.
David repaired his bicycle last weekend. He cleaned it and fixed the flat tyre. Now he can ride it to work every day again.
The class went on a trip to the zoo. They saw lions, elephants, and monkeys. Their favourite animal was the giraffe because it was so tall.
The chef prepared a special meal for the guests. He cooked roasted chicken and fresh vegetables. Everyone said the food was delicious.

My neighbour has a beautiful garden with many colourful flowers. She spends hours there every day, watering the plants and pulling out weeds. People often stop to admire her roses and sunflowers. Her garden is the prettiest on the street.
The friends went to see a concert. The music was loud and exciting. They danced and sang along to their favourite songs all night.
The little boy built a tall tower with his building blocks. His mum clapped and said it was amazing. He smiled proudly at his creation.
It was very cold, so Anna put on her warmest coat and scarf. She then walked to the bus stop to go to work. She hoped it wouldn't snow.
The children played in the garden all afternoon. They kicked a ball and laughed a lot. When it started to rain, they ran inside to play board games.

The small cafe on the corner makes the best sandwiches in town. I often go there for lunch with my colleagues from work. Their coffee is also very good and always fresh. It's a popular place, so it's often busy.

Sarah woke up early and made herself some toast and coffee. She then walked to the park and met her friend, Tom. They talked for an hour about their plans for the weekend. After that, Sarah went home to relax.
Sarah lost her keys this morning. She looked everywhere; in her bag, under the sofa, and on the table. Finally, she found them in her coat pocket.
The football team won their game yesterday. All the players were very happy. They celebrated their victory at a local restaurant.

The students went on a school trip to a science museum. They saw many interesting experiments and learned about space. Their favourite part was a room where they could touch real meteorites. It was a very educational day.
Every morning, my dog barks at the postman. The postman always smiles and gives my dog a little pat. It's a funny routine they have.

A young family moved into a new house last summer. They spent many weekends painting the walls and planting flowers in the garden. Their children loved exploring the big backyard. It quickly felt like home.
David went to the shop to buy some milk. On his way, he saw a small cat sitting on a wall. He bought the milk and then went home to make tea.
My sister likes to draw. Last night, she drew a picture of a big tree with many birds. She plans to give the picture to our mum as a gift.

It was raining heavily, so Lisa decided to stay indoors and read. She chose a mystery book from her shelf. She sat by the window, listening to the rain, and got lost in the story. She didn't even notice when the rain stopped.
Last summer, my family went camping by a lake. We put up our tent and made a campfire. In the evening, we roasted marshmallows and told stories. The stars were very bright. It was a wonderful trip.

story.prompt: Mr. Henderson, the baker, decided to try a new recipe for apple pies. He spent all morning mixing ingredients and baking them in his oven. When the first pie was ready, he let it cool on the counter. His daughter, Lily, came home from school and immediately smelled the delicious pie. She asked if she could have a slice, and Mr. Henderson happily said yes. It was the best pie she had ever tasted!

questions.prompt: What did Mr. Henderson decide to try?
Who smelled the pie when they came home?
What did Lily think of the pie?

story.prompt: Maria loves to read, so she goes to the library every Saturday morning. Last weekend, she was looking for a new book about history. The librarian, a very helpful woman, showed Maria where the history books were. Maria found a book about ancient Egypt and decided to borrow it. She checked out the book and walked home, excited to start reading.

questions.prompt: When does Maria go to the library?
What kind of book was Maria looking for?
Who helped Maria find a book?

story.prompt: Yesterday, Tom was walking home from the shop when he realised his wallet was missing. He checked his pockets, but it wasn't there. He started to feel worried because his money and cards were inside. Tom quickly walked back along the street, looking carefully on the ground. Luckily, he found it next to a bus stop, just where he had been standing.

questions.prompt: What did Tom realise was missing?
Why was Tom worried?
Where did Tom find his wallet?

story.prompt: Two friends, Leo and Sam, decided to build a treehouse in Sam's backyard. They collected some old pieces of wood and borrowed tools from Sam's dad. questions.prompt: What did Leo and Sam decide to build?

How long did it take them to build the treehouse?

questions.prompt: Where did the Miller family go for their holiday?
